content:
Feature Used in Model Building


This section outlines the key sensor-based features incorporated in the predictive maintenance model. Each variable represents a specific operational dimension within the building infrastructure and plays a vital role in identifying potential maintenance requirements.

HVAC_Temp

  • Records the temperature output from the HVAC system, serving as an indicator of the heating and cooling performance. Abnormal values may highlight issues in climate control or thermal regulation systems.

Water_Pressure

  • Measures the water pressure within the plumbing network. Consistent or extreme deviations in pressure levels can be early indicators of leaks, blockages, or pump malfunctions.

Power_Usage

  • Reflects the total energy consumption across the facility. Elevated or fluctuating readings may suggest inefficiencies, equipment overload, or energy distribution problems.

Elevator_Vibration

  • Captures the intensity of vibrations in the elevator system. Increased vibration patterns often signify mechanical wear, component misalignment, or impending system failures.

Smoke_Level

  • Indicates the concentration of smoke particles in the monitored area. This is a critical feature for detecting fire risks or deteriorating air quality, both of which require prompt attention.
description: The features used in model building represent critical sensor readings that monitor environmental conditions, equipment performance, and utility usage to predict maintenance needs.
